commit_message:
Add if_exist parameter to SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand

Like in other commands this patch is adding a "if_exist" parameter to
SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand. This will later be used by the
journal recovery module.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I093bc5982a71bd2d893a41a53194be3384b44088

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-08-04 18:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/tutorials/plugin.rst', 'doc/source/admin/index.rst', 'releasenotes/source/folsom.rst', 'doc/source/configuration/settings.rst', 'releasenotes/source/kilo.rst', 'doc/source/install/from-source.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/contributing.rst', 'CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/translation.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/ref/local_conf.rst', 'doc/source/user/stacks.rst', 'releasenotes/source/icehouse.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/microversion_support.rst', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Update the documentation link for doc migration

This commit updates links affected by doc migration.
Note that other links are not touched in this commit.
Fixing other broken links or changing http to https
should be covered by a separate patch.

Also convert http links to docs.openstack.org to https per reviewer
request (though it is not directly related to doc-migration).

Note that this commit does not touch files under releasenotes/notes/.
If we touch release notes in older releases, reno will considers
it as a release note in the current release.
(Pike release notes are clean up in a separate patch.)

Change-Id: Iba9bd465ef08014a4972584cf4da6e7d77961119
'}]
commit_message:
Update the documentation link for doc migration

This commit updates links affected by doc migration.
Note that other links are not touched in this commit.
Fixing other broken links or changing http to https
should be covered by a separate patch.

Also convert http links to docs.openstack.org to https per reviewer
request (though it is not directly related to doc-migration).

Note that this commit does not touch files under releasenotes/notes/.
If we touch release notes in older releases, reno will considers
it as a release note in the current release.
(Pike release notes are clean up in a separate patch.)

Change-Id: Iba9bd465ef08014a4972584cf4da6e7d77961119

subject: use qos constants from neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-26 17:57:38.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ml2/qos_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': "use qos constants from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the qos constants now, and neutron is moving to it
in I6ed379b178a2b79fd14385a1d1e87d87eb04bfb9. This patch moves all
references from neutron's qos constants to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I2d7aba76dd81e4ba00d7fc9e57cd97efab40f18d
"}]
commit_message:
use qos constants from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the qos constants now, and neutron is moving to it
in I6ed379b178a2b79fd14385a1d1e87d87eb04bfb9. This patch moves all
references from neutron's qos constants to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I2d7aba76dd81e4ba00d7fc9e57cd97efab40f18d

subject: use qos DriverBase from neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-25 20:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ml2/qos_driver.py'], 'message': 'use qos DriverBase from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the QoS DriverBase class and neutron is moving
to it in Ic8027b73f82d691bd3c465061a4c8d8301288b07. This patch
updates reference of such to also use neutron-lib.

Change-Id: If69880187b0914a79cea0dddcc0cf8914c62337d
'}]
commit_message:
use qos DriverBase from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the QoS DriverBase class and neutron is moving
to it in Ic8027b73f82d691bd3c465061a4c8d8301288b07. This patch
updates reference of such to also use neutron-lib.

Change-Id: If69880187b0914a79cea0dddcc0cf8914c62337d

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-19 07:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/huawei/test_huawei_drivers.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_utils.py'], 'message': "Eliminate randomness in encode_name&encode_host_name methods

Use 'md5' instead of 'hash' to generate a

Closes-Bug: #1658725

commit_message:
Eliminate randomness in encode_name&encode_host_name methods

Use 'md5' instead of 'hash' to generate a
shorter lun name and host name for Huawei backend.

Change-Id: Ie0361f47ed7947b368888859b488ae87615569e0
Closes-Bug: #1658725

commit_message:
[BugFix] Add 'instance_uuid' in update_attachment API

There are some issues around new attach/detach API/CLI,
fix them step by step. This patch add 'instance_uuid'
support in update_attachment API.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1675992

Change-Id: I43267340647c19215df18a77c49e227822a3ed32

commit_message:
Improve oslo-config-generator setting

* Use oslo-config-generator config file to generate ml2_conf.ini.
  This can be used by oslo_config sphinxext in a follow-up patch.
* Generate metadata_agent.ini sample automatically.
  Previously metadata_agent.ini was maintained manually.
* Update .gitignore not to ignore etc directory.
  I see no good reason not to maintain etc directory in the repo.
* Update devstack plugin to ensure the output directory
  where the ml2_conf sample file will be generated.

Preparation for auto-generated config reference
as part of doc-migration community-wide effort.

Change-Id: I64c6c66f9e14b558733254e9c9c2c64d647b70f8

commit_message:
Allow specification of only neutron net without subnet

in addition to existing approach where we are allowed to choose only
network with specific subnet.
It is useful when we have lots of small subnets and it is possible
to exceed amount of available IP addresses in it. In this case, we
will allow user to specify only network and delegate subnet choice
to server.

Change-Id: I23c21fe65552c0def527c98a5fa6a4eae56a6a7a

revisions:

In zuulv3 we no longer have access to the configure_mirrors.sh
ready-script in nodepool, as a result we are not using any regional
mirrors today.  This attempts to fix it by setting up /etc/pip.conf to
use our mirrors.

We also need to collect facts, as configure-mirror depends on them.

commit_message:
Configure regional mirrors for our jobs

In zuulv3 we no longer have access to the configure_mirrors.sh
ready-script in nodepool, as a result we are not using any regional
mirrors today.  This attempts to fix it by setting up /etc/pip.conf to
use our mirrors.

We also need to collect facts, as configure-mirror depends on them.

Change-Id: Idbf486f65b2c0a3701e48f7503b4affa3606b50f
Depends-On: Iebee5f1533786ff10eca889d8cb896cc848c864b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Rename to openstack-base for top-level job

As we start to bring zuul-base-jobs online, to avoid confusing rename
our base job to openstack-base.  This way we know which base we are
referring too.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Make cache-devstack optional for image builds

Move symlink of /home/jenkins/cache/files to cache-devstack, since it
is cache-devstack that create the files. This means that
cache-devstack will now depend on jenkins-slave.

Change-Id: Ief51016d1dda2afa13655e5e7e82720c3beea9ad
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Revert "Use caching reverse proxy for pypi"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 20:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Revert "Use caching reverse proxy for pypi"

This reverts commit 18cfa2598c0d5a04cb6543610b6a0c4cd5cd4bde.

This didn't catastrophically fail but we are seeing that when new
releases to python packages are made our cached indexes for these
packages are lagging in noticeable ways. We can likely get away with
this for the most part but it desynchonizes the afs volume releases
across regions and could possibly cause problems with timing as we get
into release time.

Change-Id: Ib50545f9cab0ba583127450e2c83a0c464c6f68a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use caching reverse proxy for pypi"

This reverts commit 18cfa2598c0d5a04cb6543610b6a0c4cd5cd4bde.

This didn't catastrophically fail but we are seeing that when new
releases to python packages are made our cached indexes for these
packages are lagging in noticeable ways. We can likely get away with
this for the most part but it desynchonizes the afs volume releases
across regions and could possibly cause problems with timing as we get
into release time.

Change-Id: Ib50545f9cab0ba583127450e2c83a0c464c6f68a

subject: Use the tag when grabbing the projects list
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-02 23:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_election/utils.py'], 'message': 'Use the tag when grabbing the projects list

The helper that added the tag to the cgit url was incorrectly appending
a simple "?tag" rather than "?h=tag"  cgit treats the tag as an unknown
option and is silently ignoring it.

Correct that.

The impact on the election is that any candidacies may have validated
may have included extra-atcs or repos added by the TV after the tagging
of the repo.  Checking the governance repo we see:

$ git log --no-merges --oneline aug-2017-elections..origin/master -- reference/projects.yaml
9b64bcb Adds oswin-tempest-plugin for Winstackers

This change clearly only affects the Winstackers candidates.

Change-Id: I1dfc47cb41aac4ce70d280e860ee4536cb90fd17
'}]
commit_message:
Use the tag when grabbing the projects list

The helper that added the tag to the cgit url was incorrectly appending
a simple "?tag" rather than "?h=tag"  cgit treats the tag as an unknown
option and is silently ignoring it.

Correct that.

The impact on the election is that any candidacies may have validated
may have included extra-atcs or repos added by the TV after the tagging
of the repo.  Checking the governance repo we see:

$ git log --no-merges --oneline aug-2017-elections..origin/master -- reference/projects.yaml
9b64bcb Adds oswin-tempest-plugin for Winstackers

This change clearly only affects the Winstackers candidates.

Change-Id: I1dfc47cb41aac4ce70d280e860ee4536cb90fd17

subject: Enable minimum CentOS repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 23:59:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ara.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable minimum CentOS repositories

This is a "backport" from the OSA change introduced in
I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e.

The CentOS CI images have many yum repositories enabled by default.
This can cause package conflicts in gate jobs and it doesn't match
what a basic CentOS system would look like for an OpenStack-Ansible
deployer.

This patch disables all repositories for the ansible-role-jobs and
only enables base, epel, and updates. This allows individual roles
to add extra repositories when they need them.

Change-Id: I8fea27726eb674aeb1656f05613b0ebd2cb761bb
Related-Bug: 1708493
'}]
commit_message:
Enable minimum CentOS repositories

This is a "backport" from the OSA change introduced in
I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e.

The CentOS CI images have many yum repositories enabled by default.
This can cause package conflicts in gate jobs and it doesn't match
what a basic CentOS system would look like for an OpenStack-Ansible
deployer.

This patch disables all repositories for the ansible-role-jobs and
only enables base, epel, and updates. This allows individual roles
to add extra repositories when they need them.

Change-Id: I8fea27726eb674aeb1656f05613b0ebd2cb761bb
Related-Bug: 1708493

commit_message:
Fix duplicate module names in Puppetfiles

Branch stable/newton already has that commit, this
will cause a duplicate warn because  Puppetfile in
puppet-openstack-integration will add puppet-tripleo
Puppetfile_extra twice.
Revert "rake_tasks: support Puppetfile_extras"
This reverts commit e122537c0aa9cd463edb8036dfa9ac93aa193c9a.

Change-Id: I53e321fc11034334160d08fcf079bc7e126adc14
Closes-Bug: 1708657

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2017-07-31 22:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['deploy-guide/source/configure.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app-advanced-config-options.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app-custom-layouts.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app-resources.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app-networking.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app-ceph.rst', 'etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example', 'deploy-guide/source/app-config-pod.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/app-limited-connectivity.rst', 'osa_toolkit/generate.py', 'deploy-guide/source/app-security.rst', 'etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.pod.example', 'tests/test_inventory.py', 'etc/network/interfaces.d/openstack_interface.cfg.pod.example'], 'message': "Support cidr_networks in L3 network environments

In some environments, a single container, storage, or tunnel network may
not be applicable to every host. Each configured provider_network would
need to be limited to a particular subset of hosts and the host var keys
within the inventory for container_address, storage_address, and
tunnel_address will need to be maintained since they're specifically
required by various playbooks.

Add two new options for configuring provider_networks, 'reference_group'
and 'address_prefix'.

'reference_group' for providing a group name that any host must
be a member of, in addition to any of the groups listed in
'group_binds', for the network to be applied.

'address_prefix' for overriding the name of the key created for each IP
address allocated by a cidr_network. By default, this key is named
'cidr_network'_address, where 'cidr_network' is the given 'ip_from_q'
option for a provider network.

Closes-Bug: 1650356

Change-Id: Ia7f3119f0affc4fb6be97ca788ca3b46096b82a8
"}]
commit_message:
Support cidr_networks in L3 network environments

In some environments, a single container, storage, or tunnel network may
not be applicable to every host. Each configured provider_network would
need to be limited to a particular subset of hosts and the host var keys
within the inventory for container_address, storage_address, and
tunnel_address will need to be maintained since they're specifically
required by various playbooks.

Add two new options for configuring provider_networks, 'reference_group'
and 'address_prefix'.

'reference_group' for providing a group name that any host must
be a member of, in addition to any of the groups listed in
'group_binds', for the network to be applied.

'address_prefix' for overriding the name of the key created for each IP
address allocated by a cidr_network. By default, this key is named
'cidr_network'_address, where 'cidr_network' is the given 'ip_from_q'
option for a provider network.

Closes-Bug: 1650356

Change-Id: Ia7f3119f0affc4fb6be97ca788ca3b46096b82a8

subject: Prompt to clear breakpoints when using deployed-server
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-02 22:05:38.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'tripleo_common/_stack_update.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deployed-server-clear-breakpoint-ee1a984f3366598a.yaml'], 'message': "Prompt to clear breakpoints when using deployed-server

On a minor interactive update, we never prompoted to clear breakpoints
when using deployed-server since the code reads the server id's from
nova, of which there are none.

This modifies the behavior to read the server id's and names from Heat
when nova returns no servers.

Change-Id: I682f6dc66705c9d42b9c2d21f675491ea60c9c3c
Closes-Bug: #1708236
"}]
commit_message:
Prompt to clear breakpoints when using deployed-server

On a minor interactive update, we never prompoted to clear breakpoints
when using deployed-server since the code reads the server id's from
nova, of which there are none.

This modifies the behavior to read the server id's and names from Heat
when nova returns no servers.

Change-Id: I682f6dc66705c9d42b9c2d21f675491ea60c9c3c
Closes-Bug: #1708236

subject: Fix creating LB with IP address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 22:26:46.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/network/drivers/neutron/test_allowed_address_pairs.py', 'octavia/network/drivers/neutron/allowed_address_pairs.py'], 'message': 'Fix creating LB with IP address

Previously, if you created a load balancer with an assigned IP address via
the Octavia V2 API the VIP would be created with an neutron assigned IP
address instead of the IP specified at LB creation time.
This patch corrects the behavior to have neutron attempt to use the IP
address specified, if there was one, when creating the VIP port.

Change-Id: If753b5761c5fc0550cbbc57e798363ff350304ad
Closes-Bug: #1695331
Co-Authored-By: Pradeep Kumar Singh <ps4openstack@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix creating LB with IP address

Previously, if you created a load balancer with an assigned IP address via
the Octavia V2 API the VIP would be created with an neutron assigned IP
address instead of the IP specified at LB creation time.
This patch corrects the behavior to have neutron attempt to use the IP
address specified, if there was one, when creating the VIP port.

Change-Id: If753b5761c5fc0550cbbc57e798363ff350304ad
Closes-Bug: #1695331
Co-Authored-By: Pradeep Kumar Singh <ps4openstack@gmail.com>

subject: Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-04 19:27:04.000000000', 'files': ['grafana/nodepool-osic.yaml', 'nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool

Sadly the time has come where the OSIC cloud is needing to be fully
decom'd. It's with great sadness that write this commit message
and submit this PR however, as everyone is well aware, the OSIC
agreement between Rackspace and Intel has been discontinued for
some time and while Rackspace was able to keep the environment
online through feature freeze we must now sunset the environment
effective immediately.

I want to personally thank everyone within the community,
specifically the infrastructure team, for their time and effort
in using and supporting this source based publicly accessible
private cloud. The learnings we've had from this environment
have been invaluable and IMHO we've helped strengthen our
respective communities (deployer, operator, developer, users).
For me personally, It's been a wonderful experience building
and operating the OSIC and it's my hope that one day we can
do something like this again.

Change-Id: I2d1b0710e875bd1ebc305fb5b184b68bf18f2ef7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool

Sadly the time has come where the OSIC cloud is needing to be fully
decom'd. It's with great sadness that write this commit message
and submit this PR however, as everyone is well aware, the OSIC
agreement between Rackspace and Intel has been discontinued for
some time and while Rackspace was able to keep the environment
online through feature freeze we must now sunset the environment
effective immediately.

I want to personally thank everyone within the community,
specifically the infrastructure team, for their time and effort
in using and supporting this source based publicly accessible
private cloud. The learnings we've had from this environment
have been invaluable and IMHO we've helped strengthen our
respective communities (deployer, operator, developer, users).
For me personally, It's been a wonderful experience building
and operating the OSIC and it's my hope that one day we can
do something like this again.

Change-Id: I2d1b0710e875bd1ebc305fb5b184b68bf18f2ef7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove datastore_name and datacenter_path

the VMware driver were supposed to be removed as of Liberty and
its now Mitaka.

see:
https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/master/glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py

commit_message:
Implement uWSGI for heat api services

As part of the Pike goals we are moving api services to run as WSGI
apps. heat-api, heat-api-cfn, and heat-api-cloudwatch are now set
up as WSGI apps.

Since this is just a drop in replacement for existing eventlet services,
operators and deployers should not notice a difference.

Change-Id: I3dba17c33a7f1a1b9a03020a650e258099b4d20d
Implements: blueprint goal-deploy-api-in-wsgi

Add a data file for defining gerrit queries so we can track incomplete
work for known initiatives when reviewing releases. Include a query
for patches owned by the proposal bot (to watch for requirements
updates and other automated changes) and another to watch for
documentation file updates (to let us monitor the doc migration
initiative for pike).

Change-Id: I12c59d83267bf80773876e81b3470bfe3062ad27
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add watched queries to list-changes

Add a data file for defining gerrit queries so we can track incomplete
work for known initiatives when reviewing releases. Include a query
for patches owned by the proposal bot (to watch for requirements
updates and other automated changes) and another to watch for
documentation file updates (to let us monitor the doc migration
initiative for pike).

Change-Id: I12c59d83267bf80773876e81b3470bfe3062ad27
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:

Also, remove log level for "keystone" since that would never

subject: Add a switch for the gate job exit tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 17:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': 'Add a switch for the gate job exit tasks

Before, they could only be enabled if /etc/nodepool exists. Now,
they are enabled if /etc/nodepool exists, or also if an env var
called "GATE_EXIT_LOG_COPY" is true. Also add a switch to disable
the gzipping of log files, enabled by default, called
GATE_EXIT_LOG_GZIP.

Also remove a var that is not referenced by anything in OSA called
OSA_GATE_JOB. It is set to true in gate-check-commit.sh, but never
referenced and can probably be removed.

Change-Id: I1ae20702e42666d58738397829770c258c3bdc2f
'}]
commit_message:
Add a switch for the gate job exit tasks

Before, they could only be enabled if /etc/nodepool exists. Now,
they are enabled if /etc/nodepool exists, or also if an env var
called "GATE_EXIT_LOG_COPY" is true. Also add a switch to disable
the gzipping of log files, enabled by default, called
GATE_EXIT_LOG_GZIP.

Also remove a var that is not referenced by anything in OSA called
OSA_GATE_JOB. It is set to true in gate-check-commit.sh, but never
referenced and can probably be removed.

Change-Id: I1ae20702e42666d58738397829770c258c3bdc2f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-07-28 10:29:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/rest.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/test_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/common.py'], 'message': "VMAX driver - align VMAX QOS settings with front end

Currently, the QOS feature used in VMAX doesn't work with the
frontend parameters for the total bandwidth and the total IOPs
for guest. VMAX QOS should use the total_bytes_sec and total_iops_sec
so QOS enforcement can be accomplished at both the front end
(hypervisor) and the back end (VMAX), if required.

Change-Id: I996543b57920309969ebd31262bc4c859a08fea0
Closes-Bug: #1705042
"}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - align VMAX QOS settings with front end

Currently, the QOS feature used in VMAX doesn't work with the
frontend parameters for the total bandwidth and the total IOPs
for guest. VMAX QOS should use the total_bytes_sec and total_iops_sec
so QOS enforcement can be accomplished at both the front end
(hypervisor) and the back end (VMAX), if required.

Change-Id: I996543b57920309969ebd31262bc4c859a08fea0
Closes-Bug: #1705042

Related exceptions and `ssh_connect` function, together with dependency

Depends-On: I9b60c9fa24652e9e64e787cd4e5b0152f51e7a28
'}]
commit_message:
Remove SSH-based driver interfaces and drivers

SSH drivers are being unsupported for about a year now. All current
stable branches of ironic are officially supporting IPMI-capable HW
simulation via virtualbmc.
All ironic-related gate jobs have already been switched
to not use or enable those drivers.

This patch finally removes SSH-based power and managemtnt driver interfaces
and all classic drivers using those from ironic code and documentation.
Related exceptions and `ssh_connect` function, together with dependency
on `paramiko` package are removed as well.

Change-Id: Ieda7249b9cd78e3be1eff37804996295fc8d3969
Closes-Bug: #1570301
Depends-On: I9b60c9fa24652e9e64e787cd4e5b0152f51e7a28

subject: Fix haproxy_check_script for delete listener
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-03 02:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/functional/amphorae/backend/agent/api_server/test_server.py', 'octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/listener.py'], 'message': 'Fix haproxy_check_script for delete listener

When delete one of the listeners in active standby mode,
the haproxy_check_script should be update too.
Delete method dose not have an action and according to the
defination of vrrp_check_script_update, the action should be
consts.AMP_ACTION_STOP to remove from listener_ids.
This path will fix keepalived in fault state by updating the
haproxy_check_script.

Change-Id: I22c9e4194fc3ea4a5d7ae4a81b2a0cf3a8219697
Closes-Bug: 1705288
(cherry picked from commit 8c635a4d98cbf9b48044555f64d29f5ddf47d9cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix haproxy_check_script for delete listener

When delete one of the listeners in active standby mode,
the haproxy_check_script should be update too.
Delete method dose not have an action and according to the
defination of vrrp_check_script_update, the action should be
consts.AMP_ACTION_STOP to remove from listener_ids.
This path will fix keepalived in fault state by updating the
haproxy_check_script.

Change-Id: I22c9e4194fc3ea4a5d7ae4a81b2a0cf3a8219697
Closes-Bug: 1705288
(cherry picked from commit 8c635a4d98cbf9b48044555f64d29f5ddf47d9cf)

commit_message:
Mark Falconstor drivers as unsupported

The Falconstor CI has not reported success for over over 29 days
and is past our CI policy.

Checking name: FalconStor CI
  first seen: 2017-06-02 03:11:42 (46 days, 21:55:09 old)
  last seen: 2017-06-19 14:31:44 (29 days, 10:35:07 old)
  last success: 2017-06-19 14:31:44 (29 days, 10:35:07 old)
  Job dsvm-cinder-fss-iscsi 98% success out of 250 comments S=245, F=5
  Job dsvm-cinder-fss-fc 97% success out of 250 comments S=244, F=6
Overall success rate: 97% of 250 comments

Per our CI non-compliance policy, this marks the drivers as unsupported.
If CI issues are not addressed by the Queens development cycle, they
will be removed.

Change-Id: Id2e17b212607f9989f02f83189dfb457f32bd66c

subject: Mark Coho driver as unsupported
revisions:

Checking name: Coho Data Storage CI

commit_message:
Mark Coho driver as unsupported

The Coho CI has not reported success in over 51 days and is past our
CI required period.

Checking name: Coho Data Storage CI
  first seen: 2017-05-28 13:30:07 (51 days, 11:35:18 old)
  last seen: 2017-07-03 19:46:18 (15 days, 5:19:07 old)
  last success:  None
  Job dsvm-tempest-coho-cinder-driver 0% success out of 240 comments S=0, F=240

Per Cinder's non-compliance policy, this patch marks the driver as
unsupported and deprecated and it will be removed in the next
cycle if the issue is not corrected.

Change-Id: Ic4e2ee817cb6e34c120760af3045b500b9d2a99f

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-02 01:10:24.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/resource_filters.json'], 'message': "Update resource_filter to keep backward compatibility

After using general filter feature, some filters which
were supported by default now aren't supported.

This patch updated the resource_filter.json to let the filters keep
the backward compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1708060
Change-Id: Idf3c4c5f03af81918369c15d05f856cc6eff7596

commit_message:
Update resource_filter to keep backward compatibility

After using general filter feature, some filters which
were supported by default now aren't supported.

This patch updated the resource_filter.json to let the filters keep
the backward compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1708060
Change-Id: Idf3c4c5f03af81918369c15d05f856cc6eff7596

commit_message:
Allow users to update images created from other projects

Currently on the angular images panel, edit image/update metadata/delete image
actions are only available for images created from the current logged in project.

This patch removed that restriction and added the policy check for the actions.

Change-Id: I17761e27f0659799d5e55e24a6106c3c7a3e5459
Closes-bug: #1698963

commit_message:
Remove duplicate sample files

The sample files were being rendered in two separate places. This
commit removes one of them and adjusts the references accordingly.
This commit also removes the sample files from the Operator guide
since they have their own dedicated section under configuration/.

Change-Id: I6da0843e2cb9dc7451d97af661a6cb4873eba671

commit_message:
Add hardware type for HPE OneView

Adds hardware type 'oneview' for HPE OneView supported
servers. 'oneview' hardware type supports deploy interfaces:
'oneview-iscsi' and 'oneview-direct' based on 'iscsi' and
'direct' deploy interfaces respectively, using 'pxe' boot.

Change-Id: I0e32f235d985016bac0272d4ad3c8edd9edda3c7
Closes-Bug: #1705544

commit_message:
Set the OSIC to 0 servers

This PR sets the OSIC cloud to 0 as we're now needing to
decom the cloud effective immediately. This PR should
allow us to drain all current jobs off the cloud so it can
be fully removed in a follow-on PR.

Change-Id: I42bceb845ef446b24335de917b5709629ec0b203
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-04 15:16:28.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rsyslog-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-magnum-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-octavia-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-rally-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-swift-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-sahara-install.yml', 'playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml', 'playbooks/os-horizon-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-trove-install.yml', 'playbooks/common-playbooks/unbound-clients.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/utility-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-aodh-install.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml', 'playbooks/galera-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-gnocchi-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-heat-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-molteniron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-ceilometer-install.yml', 'playbooks/memcached-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-designate-install.yml', 'playbooks/etcd-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-ironic-install.yml', 'playbooks/unbound-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-barbican-install.yml', 'playbooks/haproxy-install.yml', 'playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Modify unbound to JIT install clients

This change modifies the unbound playbook so that it follows a JIT
pattern allowing the playbooks to install what they need when they need
it. Prior to this change the unbound playbook would iterate through all
target hosts, including containers, and attempt to install the client
resource or simply execute the resolveconf role which would end in
failure should the target resource not be available at the time of
execution. Converting this to a JIT pattern should save general time
when installing with and without unbound on initial deployments and will
guarantee that the target hosts, including containers, have the most
up-to-date client code unpo deployment, or upgrade, of a given service.

Change-Id: I829747094cabc8027bad904cb822a6d265f48d73
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Modify unbound to JIT install clients

This change modifies the unbound playbook so that it follows a JIT
pattern allowing the playbooks to install what they need when they need
it. Prior to this change the unbound playbook would iterate through all
target hosts, including containers, and attempt to install the client
resource or simply execute the resolveconf role which would end in
failure should the target resource not be available at the time of
execution. Converting this to a JIT pattern should save general time
when installing with and without unbound on initial deployments and will
guarantee that the target hosts, including containers, have the most
up-to-date client code unpo deployment, or upgrade, of a given service.

Change-Id: I829747094cabc8027bad904cb822a6d265f48d73
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add options.workers to the template

This change draws on the charms.openstack and layer-openstack-api
changes to provide the ability to configure the number of workers that
the aodh charm starts.  Note that the mitaka version uses the simpler
'workers' option, whereas the ocata version uses the more complex WSGI
version.

Change-Id: I015b75cf674c03dd12078c13eb958b99e7936945
Depends-On: I3cea350e536306655f5f109ec67ae7f0fba35fda
Depends-On: Id4145ffaa622727523003015d7012ece2f0eae4f
Related-Bug: #1677543

commit_message:
Introduce DEFAULT_INSTANCE_PASSWORD config option

DEFAULT_INSTANCE_PASSWORD is used to set the image_ssh_password tempest
configuration variable. If the new option is not specified, then
image_ssh_password will be set to the default value [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/sampleconf.html

Change-Id: I2217894fe5cf4022952e69d5a89bb4841675fd06

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-24 14:24:07.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Tempest compute-feature-enabled overrides

This introduces two new variables, TEMPEST_COMPUTE_FEATURES_ENABLED
and TEMPEST_COMPUTE_FEATURES_DISABLED. These are lists of compute
features to enable or disable in the tempest configuration. If any
compute features are included in these lists, they will override any
previous setting of that feature in the tempest configuration.

Change-Id: I539bf351de6caf3f7393971d213bf4377a81fc7a
'}]
commit_message:
Tempest compute-feature-enabled overrides

This introduces two new variables, TEMPEST_COMPUTE_FEATURES_ENABLED
and TEMPEST_COMPUTE_FEATURES_DISABLED. These are lists of compute
features to enable or disable in the tempest configuration. If any
compute features are included in these lists, they will override any
previous setting of that feature in the tempest configuration.

Change-Id: I539bf351de6caf3f7393971d213bf4377a81fc7a

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-08-04 13:57:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/getting-started/policy_mapping.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1705485-7a1ad17b9cc99b9d.yaml', 'etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json', 'keystone/common/policies/user.py'], 'message': "Remove policy for self-service password changes

The self-service password API was left intentionally
unprotected in a change during the stable/ocata cycle:

  I4d3421c56642cfdbb25cb33b3aaaacbac4c64dd1

The default policy was not removed from the same config and as a
result it was migrated into code during the policy-in-code work.
This isn't necessary since it's not used to protect anything. Policy
should still be enforced on administrative password resets, but that
is done using the `update_user` API.

Change-Id: I431f5ef9d6d5d689a06736640d22997fbddb869c
Closes-Bug: 1705485

commit_message:
Remove policy for self-service password changes

The self-service password API was left intentionally
unprotected in a change during the stable/ocata cycle:

  I4d3421c56642cfdbb25cb33b3aaaacbac4c64dd1

The default policy was not removed from the same config and as a
result it was migrated into code during the policy-in-code work.
This isn't necessary since it's not used to protect anything. Policy
should still be enforced on administrative password resets, but that
is done using the `update_user` API.

Change-Id: I431f5ef9d6d5d689a06736640d22997fbddb869c
Closes-Bug: 1705485

subject: Exclude relnote from past releases from Pike relnotes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 07:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst', 'releasenotes/source/README.rst'], 'message': 'Exclude relnote from past releases from Pike relnotes

reno includes release notes touched in a target release
even if they are added from past releases.
The recent release note cleanup I made as part of doc8 adoption
and some other cleanup touched release notes from past releases.
As a result, we see several number of release notes from past
release in the Pike release notes unexpectedly.

Also adds a warning note to the release notes howto page

Change-Id: I127f96896488e9992d9309d76055b4883f6a62f3
Closes-Bug: #1708560
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude relnote from past releases from Pike relnotes

reno includes release notes touched in a target release
even if they are added from past releases.
The recent release note cleanup I made as part of doc8 adoption
and some other cleanup touched release notes from past releases.
As a result, we see several number of release notes from past
release in the Pike release notes unexpectedly.

Also adds a warning note to the release notes howto page

Change-Id: I127f96896488e9992d9309d76055b4883f6a62f3
Closes-Bug: #1708560

commit_message:

Modern versions of Ansible support lists being passed to the package
module and this speeds up package installations.

This patch removes with_items and passes a list of packages to the
package module.

commit_message:
Add role_domain_id_request_body in parameters

Now use domain_id_response_body in the request parameters of
creating role, but its required is true. When we create a role,
the domain id is optional.
This patch add role_domain_id_request_body in request parameters.

Change-Id: Ib384f2b074e86691223fbc3d480fbb82a903e209

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-17 16:19:58.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Prevent tests from using utils.execute()

This change modifies the base test class so that it mocks out
utils.execute() and similar functions and forces an exception if it
gets called. If utils.execute() is mocked by the test case then it
will work. What this does is prevent un-mocked access to
utils.execute() / processutils.execute() and similar subprocess
library functions.

Inspired by Julian Edwards' patch to ironic-python-agent

Change-Id: Id3a8e6c5fce44a1f5f6f936d2a35e0660adbf086
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent tests from using utils.execute()

This change modifies the base test class so that it mocks out
utils.execute() and similar functions and forces an exception if it
gets called. If utils.execute() is mocked by the test case then it
will work. What this does is prevent un-mocked access to
utils.execute() / processutils.execute() and similar subprocess
library functions.

Inspired by Julian Edwards' patch to ironic-python-agent

Change-Id: Id3a8e6c5fce44a1f5f6f936d2a35e0660adbf086

commit_message:
Configure dockerd with --iptables=false

This change defaults --iptables=false for dockerd to avoid
having Docker create its own FORWARD iptables rules. These
rules can interact with normal OS networking rules and disable
communications between hosts on reboot.

Change-Id: I875fa14f7d810c7f0aba3b3a1b04b60a19470f0f
Closes-bug: #1708279

subject: Allow tripleo-admin creation both for Nova-managed and split-stack
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-08-02 17:16:52.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/access.yaml', 'workbooks/validations.yaml', 'workbooks/ceph-ansible.yaml'], 'message': "Allow tripleo-admin creation both for Nova-managed and split-stack

When we deploy with split-stack, we can no longer count on the
heat-admin user existing, as all the methods that we currently use to
create it depend on provisioning overcloud with Nova.

Previously the ssh access on the overcloud for administrative
tasks (manual vs. automated) was as follows for the two deployment
scenarios (Nova+Ironic vs. Split Stack):

+-----------+---------------+------------------+
|           | Nova + Ironic | Split Stack      |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| manual    | heat-admin    | (differs by env) |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| automated | heat-admin    | N/A              |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+

With this patch we'd start moving towards:

+-----------+---------------+------------------+
|           | Nova + Ironic | Split Stack      |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| manual    | heat-admin    | (differs by env) |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| automated | tripleo-admin | tripleo-admin    |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+

I haven't reused the heat-admin name, as that is discontinued even in
Heat, and using this name would be confusing, because our usage of the
admin user has nothing to do with Heat really. We just originally
reused heat-admin for validations because it already existed. (Should
anyone wish to keep using heat-admin also for Mistral automated tasks,
they can set overcloud_admin parameter of the workflow.)

By default the new workflow initializes the tripleo-admin user the
Nova way, and no parameters are required. However, when the workflow
gets ssh_user, ssh_private_key, and ssh_servers parameters, it does
the initialization using the provided ssh connection instead of trying
to look up servers in Nova. This makes it possible to use the workflow
for Split Stack environments too.

Closes-Bug: #1708180
Change-Id: Ibe8e54f7b38d8c6c8d944d2b13f0eed004c34c4c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tripleo-admin creation both for Nova-managed and split-stack

When we deploy with split-stack, we can no longer count on the
heat-admin user existing, as all the methods that we currently use to
create it depend on provisioning overcloud with Nova.

Previously the ssh access on the overcloud for administrative
tasks (manual vs. automated) was as follows for the two deployment
scenarios (Nova+Ironic vs. Split Stack):

+-----------+---------------+------------------+
|           | Nova + Ironic | Split Stack      |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| manual    | heat-admin    | (differs by env) |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| automated | heat-admin    | N/A              |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+

With this patch we'd start moving towards:

+-----------+---------------+------------------+
|           | Nova + Ironic | Split Stack      |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| manual    | heat-admin    | (differs by env) |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+
| automated | tripleo-admin | tripleo-admin    |
+-----------+---------------+------------------+

I haven't reused the heat-admin name, as that is discontinued even in
Heat, and using this name would be confusing, because our usage of the
admin user has nothing to do with Heat really. We just originally
reused heat-admin for validations because it already existed. (Should
anyone wish to keep using heat-admin also for Mistral automated tasks,
they can set overcloud_admin parameter of the workflow.)

By default the new workflow initializes the tripleo-admin user the
Nova way, and no parameters are required. However, when the workflow
gets ssh_user, ssh_private_key, and ssh_servers parameters, it does
the initialization using the provided ssh connection instead of trying
to look up servers in Nova. This makes it possible to use the workflow
for Split Stack environments too.

Closes-Bug: #1708180
Change-Id: Ibe8e54f7b38d8c6c8d944d2b13f0eed004c34c4c

subject: Fix oslo _i18n issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 13:24:49.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gen-oslo-openstack-helm/generate.py'], 'message': 'Fix oslo _i18n issue

While trying to regenerate the .conf files, the gen-oslo-openstack-helm
tool spits back an error because of the removal of log translations in
OpenStack [0].  This patch set replaces the removed _LW() with the default
_() so the tool does not error out unexpectedly.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/commit/d5e3652d12210df1625b854749e9552b6e3f315e

Change-Id: I665775ae075b6ce0d1aa74ca5732e9e6566ff174
'}]
commit_message:
Fix oslo _i18n issue

While trying to regenerate the .conf files, the gen-oslo-openstack-helm
tool spits back an error because of the removal of log translations in
OpenStack [0].  This patch set replaces the removed _LW() with the default
_() so the tool does not error out unexpectedly.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/commit/d5e3652d12210df1625b854749e9552b6e3f315e

Change-Id: I665775ae075b6ce0d1aa74ca5732e9e6566ff174

subject: Allow detaching disks by serial tag
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-08-04 09:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/detach_disk_by_tag-9d8d5b04f91fedd2.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow detaching disks by serial tag

At the moment, we allow tagging attached passthrough disks. It is
assumed that this tag will uniquely indentify a disk (Nova uses the
Cinder volume id).

At the same time, a passthrough disk cannot be attached to multiple
instances hosted by the same node (as opposed to VHDSet images, for
example). Also, having to identify a disk path each time can be a
time consuming operation.

Having this in mind, it makes sense to allow detaching passthrough
disks from VMs by using their serial tag instead of relying on the
actual disk resource path.

Related-Bug: #1694671

Change-Id: Ic3775c3e81a5f05b20221ef52e393fdb54d0190c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow detaching disks by serial tag

At the moment, we allow tagging attached passthrough disks. It is
assumed that this tag will uniquely indentify a disk (Nova uses the
Cinder volume id).

At the same time, a passthrough disk cannot be attached to multiple
instances hosted by the same node (as opposed to VHDSet images, for
example). Also, having to identify a disk path each time can be a
time consuming operation.

Having this in mind, it makes sense to allow detaching passthrough
disks from VMs by using their serial tag instead of relying on the
actual disk resource path.

Related-Bug: #1694671

Change-Id: Ic3775c3e81a5f05b20221ef52e393fdb54d0190c

This new switch can be used to select a different input template format. The
default will be 'spec.j2' which is the current renderspec behavior.
The plan is to add an extra input format called 'yaml' which can render

commit_message:
Introduce a new --input-template-format switch

This new switch can be used to select a different input template format. The
default will be 'spec.j2' which is the current renderspec behavior.
The plan is to add an extra input format called 'yaml' which can render
a yaml data structure into .spec files for the different spec styles.

Change-Id: Id3ded3ee85f4f32ea6b85d979ca04df97c07cf49

commit_message:
Switch requires for wait-for-settle into resource collectors

This makes requiring that exec optional (only if it's in the resource
catalog), instead of needing that logic for the require and the
variable.

Also, wait-for-settle has an explicit dependency to start before any
pacemaker resource, property, constraint and bundle; so there is less
code repetition.

Change-Id: I61f3393b88b65d29e2f2a5fdf6c2e2a112bfc9a1

subject: Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 07:31:22.000000000', 'files': ['firstapp/samples/openstacksdk/introduction.py', 'firstapp/samples/openstacksdk/getting_started.py'], 'message': 'Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.itervalues
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.values instead,
  as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
  And dict.values will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I27d3b04df19b964fe83e30ee383fcc1399dae3c3
'}]
commit_message:
Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.itervalues
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.values instead,
  as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
  And dict.values will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I27d3b04df19b964fe83e30ee383fcc1399dae3c3

commit_message:
Change supported vif type in Linux Bridge.

With [1], the vif_type for a Linux Bridge port is set
to 'tap', replacing 'bridge'. This definition needs to be
changed in the list of supported vif types in the pluging
driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447150/

Change-Id: I715565627b2446533298b5905edbaa256bd84c92
Closes-Bug: #1694190

The deprecation for the E-Series iSCSI/FC drivers
begins this release (Pike) and the drivers will be removed
in Queens. We will run the E-Series CI until
stable/pike is tagged EOL; no new features will be added,
however, existing code may be meaningfully refactored to
keep the drivers ready for removal.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie4450529b128c12cc0108fbf7e68d02399c87942
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Deprecate E-Series drivers

The deprecation for the E-Series iSCSI/FC drivers
begins this release (Pike) and the drivers will be removed
in Queens. We will run the E-Series CI until
stable/pike is tagged EOL; no new features will be added,
however, existing code may be meaningfully refactored to
keep the drivers ready for removal.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie4450529b128c12cc0108fbf7e68d02399c87942

subject: Install pyOpenSSL on CentOS
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-04 14:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': "Install pyOpenSSL on CentOS

python2-pyOpenSSL is only available from the CentOS RDO QEMU repo
and that repo is not commonly installed on a basic CentOS 7 system.
It happens to be pre-installed in the OpenStack CI gates and that's
why this bindep file works.

However, this package installation fails on a normal CentOS 7
system and it can cause problems during deployment or testing.

The EPEL repository has a package called pyOpenSSL that provides
python bindings for OpenSSL on CentOS systems. That should be used
instead.

In addition, dnf will fail entirely with a bad exit code if a package
isn't found. The yum package manager will trudge on without errors.

Closes-Bug: 1708493
Depends-On: I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e
Change-Id: I93de939304b57a211f2eb281365d5a591752be7d
"}]
commit_message:
Install pyOpenSSL on CentOS

python2-pyOpenSSL is only available from the CentOS RDO QEMU repo
and that repo is not commonly installed on a basic CentOS 7 system.
It happens to be pre-installed in the OpenStack CI gates and that's
why this bindep file works.

However, this package installation fails on a normal CentOS 7
system and it can cause problems during deployment or testing.

The EPEL repository has a package called pyOpenSSL that provides
python bindings for OpenSSL on CentOS systems. That should be used
instead.

In addition, dnf will fail entirely with a bad exit code if a package
isn't found. The yum package manager will trudge on without errors.

Closes-Bug: 1708493
Depends-On: I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e
Change-Id: I93de939304b57a211f2eb281365d5a591752be7d

commit_message:
Replace six.itervalues() with dict.values() in python-novaclient

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.itervalues
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.values instead, as it
  will return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.values will
  more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I77df96b09fc0b66449339a474ac725edb890c0bc

commit_message:
Implement uWSGI for octavia-api

As part of the Pike goals we are moving api services to run as WSGI
apps. octavia-api service is set up as a wsgi app, and this patch
moves it over to uWSGI.

Since this is just a drop in replacement for the existing eventlet
service, operators an deployers should notice no difference.

Additionally, fix bug whereby git_install_branch was set to
"stable/ocata" for testing.

Change-Id: I0c473977e015015bd252a486c7191a95781b38a4
Implements: blueprint goal-deploy-api-in-wsgi

subject: Remove the test that counts kombu connect calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 01:57:19.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Remove the test that counts kombu connect calls

This test removes a check of the number of times kombu's
Connection.connect() method is being called for each mocked retry.
The number of calls kombu makes internally is irrelevant to proving
the API is correct.  The rest of the tests do ensure that the target
method is retried as expected, which is relevant to the API.

This change is necessary due to the kombu v4.1.0 release actually
calling Connection.connect() twice for each call to the target method
when compaired to earlier releases.

Change-Id: I3326b8e92efe3bef00b1f389d81944af9cc080f8
Closes-Bug: #1707263
(cherry picked from commit 2c9ac202ebeaf0fca3316a3231d75d86718a97cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the test that counts kombu connect calls

This test removes a check of the number of times kombu's
Connection.connect() method is being called for each mocked retry.
The number of calls kombu makes internally is irrelevant to proving
the API is correct.  The rest of the tests do ensure that the target
method is retried as expected, which is relevant to the API.

This change is necessary due to the kombu v4.1.0 release actually
calling Connection.connect() twice for each call to the target method
when compaired to earlier releases.

Change-Id: I3326b8e92efe3bef00b1f389d81944af9cc080f8
Closes-Bug: #1707263
(cherry picked from commit 2c9ac202ebeaf0fca3316a3231d75d86718a97cf)

commit_message:
Dynamically retrieve the location of ARA to work on both py2 & py3

Remove the hardcoded callback path with python2.7 and use the
virtualenv python to determine the path where ARA is installed so
that no matter if we're running py2 or py3, it will work.

Change-Id: Icc739743294d303d0a9e6e5a57b05f3e794e2215

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-02 03:49:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Instance remains in migrating state forever

An unexpected failure during live migration leaves the instance
to migrating state forever.
The issue is that in case of unexpected failure the task state is
set to be same as the instance task state. It should be set to
'None' instead.

Change-Id: I254977fbebf87ac712322f321792a5dfe3f0df0e

commit_message:
Instance remains in migrating state forever

An unexpected failure during live migration leaves the instance
to migrating state forever.
The issue is that in case of unexpected failure the task state is
set to be same as the instance task state. It should be set to
'None' instead.

Change-Id: I254977fbebf87ac712322f321792a5dfe3f0df0e
Closes-Bug: 1694406
(cherry picked from commit 2d3486d0ee72bc5fdd6982b9cab76c8ca9015848)

subject: Add warning state to validation status icons
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-26 09:50:32.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/validations/ValidationStatusIcon.js', 'src/js/selectors/validations.js'], 'message': 'Add warning state to validation status icons

Currently the status icon indicating a validation's status only knows
5 states: Not started, running, success, failed and error. Some
validations add warnings to their output even after they have succeeded,
indicating that operators might check their settings (e.g. the
undercloud process count validation).

This patch adds a sixth state, "warning", to the status icon, to make it
clear for users they should check the details in the validation dialog.

Change-Id: I706d1f727b3a847f8c5a23842dbef1ad30239ebc
'}]
commit_message:
Add warning state to validation status icons

Currently the status icon indicating a validation's status only knows
5 states: Not started, running, success, failed and error. Some
validations add warnings to their output even after they have succeeded,
indicating that operators might check their settings (e.g. the
undercloud process count validation).

This patch adds a sixth state, "warning", to the status icon, to make it
clear for users they should check the details in the validation dialog.

Change-Id: I706d1f727b3a847f8c5a23842dbef1ad30239ebc

commit_message:
Change the directory for haproxy certs/keys to be service-specific

This moves the directories containing the certs/keys for haproxy one step
further inside the hierarchy. This way we will be able to bind-mount
this certificate into the container without bind-mounting any other
certs/keys from other services.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Depends-On: Iba3adb9464a755e67c6f87d1233b3affa8be565a
Change-Id: I73df8d442b361cb5ef4e343b4ea2a198a5b95da9

subject: Enable minimum CentOS repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-03 17:08:09.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Enable minimum CentOS repositories

The CentOS CI images have many yum repositories enabled by default.
This can cause package conflicts in gate jobs and it doesn't match
what a basic CentOS system would look like for an OpenStack-Ansible
deployer.

This patch disables all repositories for the ansible-role-jobs and
only enables base, epel, and updates. This allows individual roles
to add extra repositories when they need them.

Related-Bug: 1708493
Change-Id: I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e
"}]
commit_message:
Enable minimum CentOS repositories

The CentOS CI images have many yum repositories enabled by default.
This can cause package conflicts in gate jobs and it doesn't match
what a basic CentOS system would look like for an OpenStack-Ansible
deployer.

This patch disables all repositories for the ansible-role-jobs and
only enables base, epel, and updates. This allows individual roles
to add extra repositories when they need them.

Related-Bug: 1708493
Change-Id: I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e

commit_message:
Ensure that vif ports are unplugged during cold migration

At the moment, the vif ports are not unplugged after cold migration
on the source node.

This change addresses this issue by passing the network info when
destroying the instance.

Change-Id: I902ab7499fa1aca7fab415393a9670350b8437aa
Closes-Bug: #1705683

commit_message:
Install yum-utils on Fedora

This patch ensures that redhat-lsb-core and yum-utils are installed
on Fedora systems. This is needed for bindep and yum-config-manager
to work.

This bug is blocking the ansible-hardening gate.

Closes-Bug: 1708479
Change-Id: I706b6f5f16ad7e6b86226830e2bceab2cda28227

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-08-01 08:00:53.000000000', 'files': ['roles/undercloud-deploy/templates/undercloud-deploy.sh.j2', 'roles/undercloud-deploy/README.md', 'roles/undercloud-deploy/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Undercloud deploy custom sources of container images

Allow tripleo client to generate default parameters
for undercloud container images from docker.io/tripleoupstream
images or a given docker registry host, port, namespace and
(un)secure access mode.

Switch heat-all to run in a container defined from that template
to minimize installation of dependencies.

Change-Id: I8cb71be205aec1122cadbdb045efa71e1f7d01d1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Undercloud deploy custom sources of container images

Allow tripleo client to generate default parameters
for undercloud container images from docker.io/tripleoupstream
images or a given docker registry host, port, namespace and
(un)secure access mode.

Switch heat-all to run in a container defined from that template
to minimize installation of dependencies.

Change-Id: I8cb71be205aec1122cadbdb045efa71e1f7d01d1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix NFSHelper 0-length netmask bug

Add special case handling of 0-length netmasks in NFS helper.
This is required because nfs-utils on Linux support CIDR style
network access unless the netmask is length 0.

Also split out utility function for wrapping IPv6 addresses with
square brackets.

Closes-bug: #1707946

Change-Id: Id907478837099b250a6c88b6b5ff50c214bcdbb2

commit_message:
BFV Deploy skip minor logging, logic, and test fixes

This is a follow-up to I62e622a2b053f685c2da42ca5106bdb9bdd22dc6
addressing some minor logging, test fixes/additions that were requested
as well as correcting a minor logic discrepency between iscsi and agent
deploy preparation methods as it makes no sense to re-plug networks in
the iscsi deployment preparation method if we are not writing an image
since we will ultimately skip deployment.

Additionally, as a result of review feedback, the FlatNetwork mocks
were updated to be more consistent.

Change-Id: If6bd7e34ea92add15c3c7d8b94a2efbaf882d6ff
Partial-Bug: #1559691

subject: rake_tasks: support Puppetfile_extras
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-01 15:50:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/rake_tasks.rb'], 'message': 'rake_tasks: support Puppetfile_extras

In the case of puppet-tripleo, we would like to re-use
puppet-openstack_spec_helper/rake_tasks but we have more Puppet modules
than Puppet OpenStack, and some of them are third party (not supported
by any community).

So we would like to create a Puppetfile_extras with the modules specific to
TripleO and re-use Puppetfile from Puppet OpenStack.
This patch will merge the 2 Puppetfiles if Puppetfile_extras does exist in one
Puppet module.

Change-Id: I337fb246f326510a3bd459f777dc6a353f9d6924
(cherry picked from commit 1e8dc7f7a90c5e4e64d62881077a4fd074d5a592)
'}]
commit_message:
rake_tasks: support Puppetfile_extras

In the case of puppet-tripleo, we would like to re-use
puppet-openstack_spec_helper/rake_tasks but we have more Puppet modules
than Puppet OpenStack, and some of them are third party (not supported
by any community).

So we would like to create a Puppetfile_extras with the modules specific to
TripleO and re-use Puppetfile from Puppet OpenStack.
This patch will merge the 2 Puppetfiles if Puppetfile_extras does exist in one
Puppet module.

Change-Id: I337fb246f326510a3bd459f777dc6a353f9d6924
(cherry picked from commit 1e8dc7f7a90c5e4e64d62881077a4fd074d5a592)

Deploying a multipathd container gives the following error:
failed: [localhost] (item={'key': u'config_files', 'value': [{u'dest': u'/', u'merge': True, u'source':
u'/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-iscsid/*', u'preserve_properties': True}]}) =>
{\"checksum\": \"72ad81489381571c5043b7613f6828b06ae364bd\", \"failed\": true, \"item\":
{\"key\": \"config_files\", \"value\": [{\"dest\": \"/\", \"merge\": true, \"preserve_properties\": true,

commit_message:
Fix up multipath docker indentation

Deploying a multipathd container gives the following error:
failed: [localhost] (item={'key': u'config_files', 'value': [{u'dest': u'/', u'merge': True, u'source':
u'/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-iscsid/*', u'preserve_properties': True}]}) =>
{\"checksum\": \"72ad81489381571c5043b7613f6828b06ae364bd\", \"failed\": true, \"item\":
{\"key\": \"config_files\", \"value\": [{\"dest\": \"/\", \"merge\": true, \"preserve_properties\": true,
\"source\": \"/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-iscsid/*\"}]}, \"msg\": \"Destination directory does not exist\"}

The reason is the wrong indentation of the config_files key in the
multipath docker service.

Change-Id: I0e1fbb9eb188a903994b9e5da90ab4a6fb81f00a
Closes-Bug: #1708129

subject: Use Stevedore for better extensions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 9801, 'name': 'Eric Guo', 'username': 'eric.guo', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2017-08-01 13:04:29.000000000', 'files': ['castellan/tests/unit/key_manager/test_key_manager.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/key_manager/test_barbican_key_manager.py', 'requirements.txt', 'setup.cfg', 'castellan/key_manager/__init__.py', 'castellan/options.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/test_options.py'], 'message': 'Use Stevedore for better extensions

Since all Oslo library drivers are discoverable via
stevedore, we should use stevedore in Castellan as well.
This will make it easier for folks to write their own
custom drivers. Stevedore uses setuptools entry points
for implementing the common patterns for dynamically
loading extensions.

We add [key_manager]/backend as the new option to set
the custom driver. For a while, we should support the
older values that used to be specified using
[key_manager]/apiclass.

Change-Id: I2610459839806a5591da1efa314dfa52bcfb7cda
'}]
commit_message:
Use Stevedore for better extensions

Since all Oslo library drivers are discoverable via
stevedore, we should use stevedore in Castellan as well.
This will make it easier for folks to write their own
custom drivers. Stevedore uses setuptools entry points
for implementing the common patterns for dynamically
loading extensions.

We add [key_manager]/backend as the new option to set
the custom driver. For a while, we should support the
older values that used to be specified using
[key_manager]/apiclass.

Change-Id: I2610459839806a5591da1efa314dfa52bcfb7cda

Show instance resize and rebuild actions in red

destructive action if action_type is set to "danger".

Removed the action_type for live  migration action because it is
not a destructive action.

commit_message:

This release has a fix required for TripleO CI indicating false
positive runs.

Note this is basically a duplicate of:
 I1cd0ad7e7cf982ee4a7c668371ca0f57552c1209
Normally we'd abandon this in favor of that.  However the FFE granted
on the mailing list refers to this change so for the sake of posterity
we'll keep this one and abandon the other.

subject: Ensure directory exists for certificates for haproxy
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-02 08:13:15.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/certmonger/haproxy_dirs.pp', 'manifests/certmonger/haproxy.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/certmonger_user.pp'], 'message': "Ensure directory exists for certificates for haproxy

We used to rely on a standard directory for the certificates and keys
that are requested by certmonger. However, given the approach we plan to
take for containers that's described in the blueprint, we need to use
service-specific directories for the certs/keys, since we plan to
bind-mount these into the containers, and we don't want to bind mount
any keys/certs from other services.

Thus, we start by creating this directories if they don't exist in the
filesystem and adding the proper selinux labels.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: Iba3adb9464a755e67c6f87d1233b3affa8be565a
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure directory exists for certificates for haproxy

We used to rely on a standard directory for the certificates and keys
that are requested by certmonger. However, given the approach we plan to
take for containers that's described in the blueprint, we need to use
service-specific directories for the certs/keys, since we plan to
bind-mount these into the containers, and we don't want to bind mount
any keys/certs from other services.

Thus, we start by creating this directories if they don't exist in the
filesystem and adding the proper selinux labels.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: Iba3adb9464a755e67c6f87d1233b3affa8be565a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-03 14:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['leap-upgrades/lib/functions.sh'], 'message': "Be more lenient on input version.

RPC is using r11 and 11 for kilo, same for upper branches.
We should be more lenient to the version allowed, whether it's

same number.

Change-Id: I42053681fdc5e0b2c16060d8a51b4a620569f38c

commit_message:
Be more lenient on input version.

RPC is using r11 and 11 for kilo, same for upper branches.
We should be more lenient to the version allowed, whether it's
starting with a r or not, as long as the major version is the
same number.

Change-Id: I42053681fdc5e0b2c16060d8a51b4a620569f38c

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-26 19:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-odl-sriov-env-e31982064c2bf646.yaml', 'environments/neutron-opendaylight-sriov.yaml'], 'message': 'Adds environment file for ODL + SRIOV

Using the separate neutron-opendaylight and SRIOV env files do not work
because sriov includes using OVS agent (which ODL does not want or need)
and the default ODL env file has no Compute ML2 because it is not
needed.  Thus a new environment file is needed for deploying these 2
features in combination.

Closes-Bug: 1696667

Change-Id: I6f7a9368aa521de928c269619278c30acda03799
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adds environment file for ODL + SRIOV

Using the separate neutron-opendaylight and SRIOV env files do not work
because sriov includes using OVS agent (which ODL does not want or need)
and the default ODL env file has no Compute ML2 because it is not
needed.  Thus a new environment file is needed for deploying these 2
features in combination.

Closes-Bug: 1696667

Change-Id: I6f7a9368aa521de928c269619278c30acda03799
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

subject: Update puppet jobs to 4.8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-03 16:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Update puppet jobs to 4.8

There have been some recent merging of changes to things like stdlib
that require 4.6+. In tripleo we actually deploy with 4.8.  This change
updates the Puppet OpenStack and puppet-tripleo jobs to use 4.8 for unit
tests.

It should be noted that 4.5 equates to Puppet Enterprise 2016.2[0]
which has already reached limited support as of October of 2016[1].
4.8[2] is in PE 2016.5 which is newer than the current LTS version.

[0] https://docs.puppet.com/puppet/4.5/release_notes.html
[1] https://puppet.com/misc/puppet-enterprise-lifecycle
[2] https://docs.puppet.com/puppet/4.8/release_notes.html

Change-Id: I6091aacd692129789b95c45c0cde55e4a55ccb51
'}]
commit_message:
Update puppet jobs to 4.8

There have been some recent merging of changes to things like stdlib
that require 4.6+. In tripleo we actually deploy with 4.8.  This change
updates the Puppet OpenStack and puppet-tripleo jobs to use 4.8 for unit
tests.

It should be noted that 4.5 equates to Puppet Enterprise 2016.2[0]
which has already reached limited support as of October of 2016[1].
4.8[2] is in PE 2016.5 which is newer than the current LTS version.

[0] https://docs.puppet.com/puppet/4.5/release_notes.html
[1] https://puppet.com/misc/puppet-enterprise-lifecycle
[2] https://docs.puppet.com/puppet/4.8/release_notes.html

Change-Id: I6091aacd692129789b95c45c0cde55e4a55ccb51

commit_message:
Add 1.0 feature branch in Gerritbot for ARA

we work towards version 1.0 of ARA and it will be done in the 1.0
branch.
We intend to keep the master branch for the "stable" 0.14 release
which might end up getting bugfixes and dot releases in the meantime.

commit_message:
Change all tests of python-rsdclient and rsd-lib to voting

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2017-08-04 02:55:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/glance.py'], 'message': 'Clean /tmp after upload when using glance v2 client

When using glance v2 client, it will leave an upload

Closes-Bug: #1689694

commit_message:
Clean /tmp after upload when using glance v2 client

When using glance v2 client, it will leave an upload
tmp file in /tmp folder, which will cause upload error
if its filesystem (in memory) is full.

Change-Id: I0a7267db894e7be4216a346752d299132df9a29a
Closes-Bug: #1689694

commit_message:
Correct 'os-show_image_metadata' API document

The 'os-show_image_metadata' API is outdated.
Rewrite the document, also correct the response
codes for image metadata's create/delete APIs.

tripleo promotions.

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-02 01:02:07.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Switch to using bool for filtering non-deleted volume attributes

This avoid programmatic errors when talking to a DB backend like
Postgres due to integer/bool type mismatch.

This patch also addresses model/schema mismatches where column
'deleted' was defined as Integer, but created as Boolean.

Closes-bug: #1707989

Change-Id: I1f6da598b5bb45f7ce3deb1416eeec9ceb486f02
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to using bool for filtering non-deleted volume attributes

This avoid programmatic errors when talking to a DB backend like
Postgres due to integer/bool type mismatch.

This patch also addresses model/schema mismatches where column
'deleted' was defined as Integer, but created as Boolean.

Closes-bug: #1707989

Change-Id: I1f6da598b5bb45f7ce3deb1416eeec9ceb486f02

subject: Changing the default port-binding configuration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 20866, 'name': 'Janki Chhatbar', 'email': 'jchhatba@redhat.com', 'username': 'janki'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-27 20:21:01.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/odl-port-binding-d420cac81f714778.yaml', 'puppet/services/opendaylight-ovs.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-plugin-ml2-odl.yaml'], 'message': 'Changing the default port-binding configuration

networking-odl no longer supports the network-topology port
binding controller and instead now relies on a pseudo-agent binding
controller.  This means that each OVS node must be configured with
host configuration in OVSDB about which VIF types, network types,
functions, etc that this OVS node supports.  The end result is this
affects where nova and neutron will schedule instances.

Changes Include:
 - Modifying default port binding controller to use pseudo agent
 - Adds necessary per role parameters to be able to configure host
   config on a per role basis to allow for heterogenous compute node
   configurations.

Change-Id: I50458abf6a8a6bf724ad97accb6444d9c497d287
Closes-Bug: 1674995
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Changing the default port-binding configuration

networking-odl no longer supports the network-topology port
binding controller and instead now relies on a pseudo-agent binding
controller.  This means that each OVS node must be configured with
host configuration in OVSDB about which VIF types, network types,
functions, etc that this OVS node supports.  The end result is this
affects where nova and neutron will schedule instances.

Changes Include:
 - Modifying default port binding controller to use pseudo agent
 - Adds necessary per role parameters to be able to configure host
   config on a per role basis to allow for heterogenous compute node
   configurations.

Change-Id: I50458abf6a8a6bf724ad97accb6444d9c497d287
Closes-Bug: 1674995
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

This change also used the --env-file option to generate

commit_message:
Use prepare command for overcloud_containers.yaml

Most deployments will not be able to use the packaged
overcloud_containers.yaml unmodified, so the prepare command will
allow local modified files to be created.

Once nothing in CI consumes the packaged overcloud_containers.yaml, it
will be deleted.

This change also used the --env-file option to generate
container-default-parameters.yaml instead of the current templated
approach. There is about to be some disruption to how the namespace is
represented in the image parameters, so using the prepare command will
help mitigate that.

Change-Id: I6a5796428c224584359b2a434d7fc80878d5f038
Partial-Bug: #1696598
